intro: Stenactis bellidioides, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes and disturbed areas. Stenactis bellidioides is adapted to full sun and has a short growing season, blooming from spring to early summer.
